intro: Sisymbrium tillieri, commonly known as the field bean or yellow rocket, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and slender, branching stems. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces pods containing several seeds. Its leaves are alternate, pinnately divided, and have a slightly hairy texture. Sisymbrium tillieri is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and fields.
